1.text: Buy cabbage at its peak during the late fall and winter.

2.text: Choose cabbage with firm, vibrant, unblemished leaves.

3.text: Peel off the tough, outer leaves and rinse the cabbage with water.

4.text: Cut the stem off of the cabbage, then cut it into quarters.

5.text: Remove the center stem from each quarter.

6.text: Chop the cabbage further if you will be boiling, sautéing, or microwaving it.

7.text: Boil quartered cabbage for 8 to 10 minutes or until it is tender.

8.text: Steam quartered cabbage in a steamer basket for 10 to 12 minutes.

9.text: Sauté chopped cabbage over medium heat for 4 to 6 minutes.

10.text: Microwave quartered cabbage for 9 to 11 minutes.

11.text: Use a crockpot if you have more time.

12.text: Use an oven to make cabbage steaks.

13.text: Grill cabbage for 20 minutes for a quick summer meal.

14.text: Try Southern fried cabbage with onion and bacon.
